Detector.Details: This detector looks for code where an exception is caught, but nothing is done to handle the exception. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to pointless methods, such as the no-argument String constructor. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for instances of double checked locking. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to finalize() and other finalizer-related issues. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for problems in the definition of the hashCode() and equals() methods. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to notify() that don't seem to modify mutable object state. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for methods that return mutable static data. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to Thread.run(). It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for loops that spin reading from a field. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to wait() with two (or more) locks held. It is a slow detector.
This detector looks for calls to wait() not in a conditional or loop. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for reads of uninitialized fields in constructors. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for get and set methods where the get is unsynchronized while the set is synchronized. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for potentially circular class initialization dependencies. It is a fast detector.
This iterator looks for problems in how Iterator classes are defined. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for fields that are accessed in an inconsistent manner with respect to locking. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for comparisons of String objects using the == or != operators. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for synchronization on objects read from modified fields. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for static fields that may be modified by malicious code. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for suspiciously-named methods. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to InputStream.read() where the return value is ignored. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for potential problems in the implementation of Serializable classes. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for constructors that start threads. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for fields whose value is never read. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to wait() that are not in a loop. It is a fast detector.

This detector looks for instances of double checked locking. It is implemented using the ByteCodePattern class. You might want to take a look at its source code as an example of an easy way to implement a bug pattern detector. It is a fairly fast detector.
This detector looks for calls to methods where the return value is suspiciously ignored. It is a fairly fast detector.

This detector looks for methods that return either arrays or an explicit null reference. Returning a zero length array is generally preferred in this context to returning a null reference. It is a fast detector.
This detector looks for control flow statements which have no effect. It is a fast detector.

This detector looks for JSR-166 (java.util.concurrent) locks which are acquired, but not released on all paths out of the method.  It is a moderately fast detector.  Note that in order to use this detector, you need to have the java.util.concurrent package in the auxiliary classpath (or be analyzing the package itself).

This detector looks for places where two reference values are compared with the == or != operator, and the class is of a type (such as java.lang.String) where comparing reference values is generally an error. It is a moderately fast detector.

This detector looks for calls to wait(), notify(), or notifyAll() which do not appear to be made on an object which is currently locked.  It is a moderately fast detector.  This detector is disabled because it is still under development, and produces too many false positives.
This detector looks for fields that are accessed in an inconsistent manner with respect to locking. It is a slow detector.
This detector looks for self assignments of local variables. It is a fast detector.
This dectector just collects summary statistics information about the analysis process.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 例外を見落としている疑い
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} は {2} を見落としている疑い
BugPattern.Details: This method might drop an exception.  In general, exceptions should be handled or reported in some way, or they should be thrown out of the method.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 例外を無視している疑い
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} は {2} を無視している
BugPattern.Details: This method might ignore an exception.  In general, exceptions should be handled or reported in some way, or they should be thrown out of the method.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: コンストラクタnew String() を呼んでいる。文字列をそのまま使うべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} コンストラクタnew String() を呼んでいる。文字列をそのまま使うべき
BugPattern.Details: Using the java.lang.String(String) constructor wastes memory because the object so constructed will be functionally indistinguishable from the String passed as a parameter.  Just use the argument String directly.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: コンストラクタnew String() を呼んでいる。そのまま "" を使うべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} コンストラクタnew String() を呼んでいる。そのまま "" を使うべき
BugPattern.Details: Creating a new java.lang.String object using the no-argument constructor wastes memory because the object so created will be functionally indistinguishable from the empty string constant "".  Java guarantees that identical string constants will be represented by the same String object.  Therefore, you should just use the empty string constant directly.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 強制的にＧＣを呼んでいる。ベンチマーク以外は利用の必要性がない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} 強制的にＧＣを呼んでいる。ベンチマーク以外は利用の必要性がない
BugPattern.Details:
Code explicitly invokes garbage collection. Except for specific use in benchmarking, this is very dubious.

In the past, situations where people have explicitly invoked the garbage collector in routines such as close or finalize methods has led to huge performance black holes. Garbage collection can be expensive. Any situation that forces hundreds or thousands of garbage collections will bring the machine to a crawl.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Booleanのコンストラクタを呼んでいる。 Boolean.valueOf(...) を使うべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} Booleanのコンストラクタを呼んでいる。 Boolean.valueOf(...) を使うべき
BugPattern.Details: Creating new instances of java.lang.Boolean wastes memory, since Boolean objects are immutable and there are only two useful values of this type.  Use the Boolean.valueOf() method to create Boolean objects instead.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: ダブルチェックしている可能性がある。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {2} を {1} でダブルチェックしている可能性がある。
BugPattern.Details: This method may contain an instance of double-checked locking.  This idiom is not correct according to the semantics of the Java memory model.  For more information, see the web page http://www.cs.umd.edu/~pugh/java/memoryModel/DoubleCheckedLocking.html.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Finalizer はpublicだがprotectedであるべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はpublicだがprotectedであるべき
BugPattern.Details: A class's finalize() method should have protected access, not public.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 空なFinalizerなので削除すべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} は空なので削除すべき
BugPattern.Details: Empty finalize() methods are useless, so they should be deleted.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Finalizerはスーパークラスのfinalize(); を無視している。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はスーパークラスの {2}.finalize(); を無視している。わざと？
BugPattern.Details: This empty finalize() method explicitly negates the effect of any finalizer defined by its superclass.  Any finalizer actions defined for the superclass will not be performed.  Unless this is intended, delete this method.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: super.finalize(); 以外何もしていない。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} super.finalize(); 以外何もしていないので削除すべき
BugPattern.Details: The only thing this finalize() method does is call the superclass's finalize() method, making it redundant.  Delete it.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Finalizer にsuper.finalize()への呼び出しがない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} super.finalize()への呼び出しがないので {2}.finalize() が呼び出されない
BugPattern.Details: This finalize() method does not make a call to its superclass's finalize() method.  So, any finalizer actions defined for the superclass will not be performed.  Add a call to super.finalize().

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Finalizerを明示的に読んでいる
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} 明示的に {2}を呼んでいる
BugPattern.Details: This method contains an explicit invocation of the finalize() method on an object.  Because finalizer methods are supposed to be executed once, and only by the VM, this is a bad idea.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: covariantメソッドequals()を定義しているが, Object.equals(Object) は継承のまま
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はequals({0})メソッドを定義しているがObject.equals(Object)を利用している
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a covariant version of the equals() method, but calls the normal equals(Object) method defined in the base java.lang.Object class.  The class should probably define a non-covariant version of equals().  (I.e., a method with the signature boolean equals(java.lang.Object).

BugPattern.ShortDescription: covariantメソッドequals()を定義している
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はequals({0})メソッドを定義しているがequals(Object)を定義していない
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a covariant version of equals().  To correctly override the equals() method in java.lang.Object, the parameter of equals() must have type java.lang.Object.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: covariantメソッドcompareTo()を定義している
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はcomparesTo({0})メソッドを定義しているがcomparesTo(Object)を定義していない
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a covariant version of compareTo().  To correctly override the compareTo() method in the Comparable interface, the parameter of compareTo() must have type java.lang.Object.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: hashCode()を定義しているがObject.equals()を使っている
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はhashCodeメソッドを定義しているがObject.equals()を利用している
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a hashCode() method but inherits its equals() method from java.lang.Object (which defines equality by comparing object references).  Although this will probably satisfy the contract that equal objects must have equal hashcodes, it is probably not what was intended by overriding the hashCode() method.  (Overriding hashCode() implies that the object's identity is based on criteria more complicated than simple reference equality.)

BugPattern.ShortDescription: hashCode()を定義しているがequals()を定義していない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はhashCodeメソッドを定義しているがequalsを定義していない
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a hashCode() method but not an equals() method.  Therefore, the class may violate the invariant that equal objects must have equal hashcodes.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: equalsメソッドを定義しているがObject.hashCode()を利用している
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はequalsメソッドを定義しているがObject.hashCode()を利用している
BugPattern.Details: This class overrides equals(Object), but does not override hashCode(), and inherits the implementation of hashCode() from java.lang.Object (which returns the identity hash code, an arbitrary value assigned to the object by the VM).  Therefore, the class is very likely to violate the invariant that equal objects must have equal hashcodes.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: equalsメソッドを定義しているがhashCodeを定義してない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} はequalsメソッドを定義しているがhashCodeを定義してない
BugPattern.Details: This class overrides equals(Object), but does not override hashCode().  Therefore, the class may violate the invariant that equal objects must have equal hashcodes.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 抽象クラス はcovariantメソッドequals()を定義している
BugPattern.LongDescription: Abstract {0} はequals({0})メソッドを定義している
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a covariant version of equals().  To correctly override the equals() method in java.lang.Object, the parameter of equals() must have type java.lang.Object.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Comparison of String objects using == or !=
BugPattern.LongDescription: Comparison of String objects using == or != in {1}
BugPattern.Details: This code compares java.lang.String objects for reference equality using the == or != operators. Unless both strings are either constants in a source file, or have been interned using the String.intern() method, the same string value may be represented by two different String objects. Considering using the equals method instead.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 抽象クラス はcovariantメソッドcompareTo()を定義している
BugPattern.LongDescription: Abstract {0} はcompareTo({0})メソッドを定義している
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a covariant version of compareTo().  To correctly override the compareTo() method in the Comparable interface, the parameter of compareTo() must have type java.lang.Object.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 同期の仕方が不統一
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1}の同期の仕方が不統一。{2}% のアクセスでsynchronizedしている。
BugPattern.Details:
The fields of this class appear to be accessed inconsistently with respect to synchronization.  This bug report indicates that the bug pattern detector judged that

  1. The class contains a mix of locked and unlocked accesses,
  2. At least one locked access was performed by one of the class's own methods, and
  3. The number of unsynchronized field accesses (reads and writes) was no more than one third of all accesses, with writes being weighed twice as high as reads

A typical bug matching this bug pattern is forgetting to synchronize one of the methods in a class that is intended to be thread-safe.

You can select the nodes labeled "Unsynchronized access" to show the code locations where the detector believed that a field was accessed without synchronization.

Note that there are various sources of inaccuracy in this detector; for example, the detector cannot statically detect all situations in which a lock is held.  Also, even when the detector is accurate in distinguishing locked vs. unlocked accesses, the code in question may still be correct.

This description refers to the "IS2" version of the pattern detector, which has more accurate ways of detecting locked vs. unlocked accesses than the older "IS" detector.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: notifyは裸のまま。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} のnotifyは裸のまま。
BugPattern.Details:
A call to notify() or notifyAll() was made without any (apparent) accompanying modification to mutable object state.  In general, calling a notify method on a monitor is done because some condition another thread is waiting for has become true.  However, for the condition to be meaningful, it must involve a heap object that is visible to both threads.

This bug does not necessarily indicate an error, since the change to mutable object state may have taken place in a method which then called the method containing the notification.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Public static メソッドが配列を返すことで内部表現をばらしている可能性がある
BugPattern.LongDescription: public static {1} が {2} を返すことで内部表現をばらしている可能性がある
BugPattern.Details: A public static method returns a reference to an array that is part of the static state of the class. Any code that calls this method can freely modify the underlying array. One fix is to return a copy of the array.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: メソッドが配列を返すことで内部表現をばらしている可能性がある
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} が {2} を返すことで内部表現をばらしている可能性がある
BugPattern.Details: Returning an array value stored in one of the object's fields exposes the internal representation of the object.  For classes shared by other untrusted classes, this could potentially be a security issue.  Returning a new copy of the array is better approach in many situations.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: スレッドのrunを直接呼んでいる。（startではないか）
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} スレッドのrunを直接呼んでいる。（startではないか）
BugPattern.Details: This method explicitly invokes run() on an object.  In general, classes implement the Runnable interface because they are going to have their run() method invoked in a new thread, in which case Thread.start() is the right method to call.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: スピンロックを使っている。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {2} を使って {1} でスピンロックを使っている。
BugPattern.Details: This method spins in a loop which reads a field.  The compiler may legally hoist the read out of the loop, turning the code into an infinite loop.  The class should be changed so it uses proper synchronization (including wait and notify calls).

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 二つのロックを持ったままwait()している。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1}で二つのロックを持ったままwait()している。
BugPattern.Details: Waiting on a monitor while two locks are held may cause deadlock.  This not necessarily a bug, but is worth examining closely.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: waitに条件文がない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} のwaitに条件文がない
BugPattern.Details: This method contains a call to java.lang.Object.wait() which is not guarded by conditional control flow.  If the condition that the method intends to wait for has already happened, the thread could wait indefinitely.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: コンストラクタで初期化前のフィールドを読んでいる
BugPattern.LongDescription: {2} を {1} で初期化前に値を読んでいる。
BugPattern.Details: This constructor reads a field which has not yet been assigned a value.  This is often caused when the programmer mistakenly uses the field instead of one of the constructor's parameters.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: getメソッドは同期していないが、setメソッドは同期している。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はsynchronizedがないが、 {2} はsynchronizedがある
BugPattern.Details: This class contains similarly-named get and set methods where the set method is synchronized and the get method is not.  This may result in incorrect behavior at runtime, as callers of the get method will not necessarily see a consistent state for the object.  The get method should be made synchronized.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 初期化がループしている
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} と {1} の間でループする初期化となっている
BugPattern.Details: A circularity was detected in the static initializers of the two classes referenced by the bug instance.  Many kinds of unexpected behavior may arise from such circularity.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Iterator next() は NoSuchElement 例外を投げることはない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} は NoSuchElement 例外を投げることはない
BugPattern.Details: This class implements the java.util.Iterator interface.  However, its next() method is not capable of throwing java.util.NoSuchElementException.  The next() method should be changed so it throws NoSuchElementException if is called when there are no more elements to return.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 同期の仕方が不統一
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} のアクセスが不統一; {2}% の場合同期アクセスしている
BugPattern.Details:
The fields of this class appear to be accessed inconsistently with respect to synchronization.  This bug report indicates that the bug pattern detector judged that

  1. The class contains a mix of locked and unlocked accesses,
  2. At least one locked access was performed by one of the class's own methods, and
  3. The number of unsynchronized field accesses (reads and writes) was no more than one third of all accesses, with writes being weighed twice as high as reads

A typical bug matching this bug pattern is forgetting to synchronize one of the methods in a class that is intended to be thread-safe.

Note that there are various sources of inaccuracy in this detector; for example, the detector cannot statically detect all situations in which a lock is held.  Also, even when the detector is accurate in distinguishing locked vs. unlocked accesses, the code in question may still be correct.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 更新されるフィールドで同期している
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} 更新されるフィールド {2} で同期している
BugPattern.Details: This method synchronizes on an object references from a mutable field. This is unlikely to have useful semantics, since different threads may be synchronizing on different objects.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Field はinterfaceから取り出してパッケージプロテクトにすべき。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はinterfaceから取り出してパッケージプロテクトにすべき。
BugPattern.Details: A final static field that is defined in an interface references a mutable object such as an array or hashtable. This mutable object could be changed by malicious code or by accident from another package. So solve this, the field needs to be moved to a class and made package protected to avoid this vulnerability.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Fieldはfinalでパッケージプロテクトにすべき。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はfinalでパッケージプロテクトにすべき。
BugPattern.Details: A mutable static field could be changed by malicious code or by accident from another package. The field could be made package protected and/or made final to avoid this vulnerability.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Fieldはfinalではないがfinalにすべき。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はfinalではないがfinalにすべき。
BugPattern.Details: A mutable static field could be changed by malicious code or by accident from another package. The field could be made final to avoid this vulnerability.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Fieldはパッケージプロテクトにすべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はパッケージプロテクトにすべき
BugPattern.Details: A mutable static field could be changed by malicious code or by accident. The field could be made package protected to avoid this vulnerability.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Fieldはmutableな Hashtable
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1}はmutableな Hashtable
BugPattern.Details: A final static field references an Hashtable and can be accessed by malicious code or by accident from another package. This code can freely modify the contents of the array.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Fieldはmutableな array
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はmutableな array
BugPattern.Details: <!-- add details here --> A final static field references an array and can be accessed by malicious code or by accident from another package. This code can freely modify the contents of the array.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Field はfinalでないしfinalになれない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はfinalでないしfinalになれない
BugPattern.Details: A mutable static field could be changed by malicious code or by accident from another package. Unfortunately, the way the field is used doesn't allow any easy fix to this problem.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: メソッド名がトテモ紛らわしい
BugPattern.LongDescription: メソッド {1} とメソッド {3} を持つのはトテモわかりにくい
BugPattern.Details: The referenced methods have names that differ only by capitalization.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: メソッド名が紛らわしい
BugPattern.LongDescription: メソッド {1} とメソッド {3} を持つのはわかりにくい
BugPattern.Details: The referenced methods have names that differ only by capitalization.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: メソッド名が紛らわしい
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} のメソッド名が紛らわしい
BugPattern.Details: This method has the same name as the superclass of the class it is defined in.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Class は hashcode()を定義している。 hashCode()の間違いではないか？
BugPattern.LongDescription: クラス {0} は hashcode()を定義している。 hashCode()の間違いではないか？
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a method called hashcode().  This method does not override the hashCode() method in java.lang.Object, which is probably what was intended.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Class は tostring()を定義している。 toString()の間違いではないか？
BugPattern.LongDescription: クラス {0} は tostring()を定義している。 toString()の間違いではないか？
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a method called tostring().  This method does not override the toString() method in java.lang.Object, which is probably what was intended.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: InputStream.read()の戻り値を無視している。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} は {2} の戻り値を無視している。
BugPattern.Details: This method ignores the return value of one of the variants of java.io.InputStream.read() which can return multiple bytes.  If the return value is not checked, the caller will not be able to correctly handle the case where fewer bytes were read than the caller requested.  This is a particularly insidious kind of bug, because in many programs, reads from input streams usually do read the full amount of data requested, causing the program to fail only sporadically.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Class is Serializable, but doesn't define serialVersionUID
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0} is Serializable; consider declaring a serialVersionUID
BugPattern.Details: This class implements the Serializable interface, but does not define a serialVersionUID field.  A change as simple as adding a reference to a .class object will add synthetic fields to the class, which will unfortunately change the implicit serialVersionUID (e.g., adding a reference to String.class will generate a static field class$java$lang$String). Also, different source code to bytecode compilers may use different naming conventions for synthetic variables generated for references to class objects or inner classes. To ensure interoperability of Serializable across versions, consider adding an explicit serialVersionUID.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Class's writeObject() method is synchronized but nothing else is
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0}'s writeObject method is synchronized but nothing else is
BugPattern.Details: This class has a writeObject() method which is synchronized; however, no other method of the class is synchronized.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Class's readObject() method is synchronized
BugPattern.LongDescription: {0}'s readObject method is synchronized
BugPattern.Details: This serializable class defines a readObject() which is synchronized.  By definition, an object created by deserialization is only reachable by one thread, and thus there is no need for readObject() to be synchronized.  If the readObject() method itself is causing the object to become visible to another thread, that is an example of very dubious coding style.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: serialVersionUID isn't static
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} はstaticではない
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a serialVersionUID field that is not static.  The field should be made static.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: serialVersionUID isn't final
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} isn't final
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a serialVersionUID field that is not final.  The field should be made final if it is intended to specify the version UID for purposes of serialization.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: コンストラクタが Thread.start()を読んでいる。
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} は {2} を呼び出している
BugPattern.Details: The constructor starts a thread. This is likely to be wrong if the class is ever extended/subclasses, since the thread will be started before the subclass constructor is started.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: フィールド を読んでいない。スタティックにすべき
BugPattern.LongDescription: フィールド {1}; を読んでいない。スタティックにすべき
BugPattern.Details: This class contains an instance final field which is never read.  The fact that it is not read may indicate that the Java source to bytecode compiler has propagated its constant value.  Consider making it static.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: フィールド を使っていない
BugPattern.LongDescription: フィールド {1} を使っていない
BugPattern.Details: This field is never used.  Consider removing it from the class.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: フィールド を読んでいない
BugPattern.LongDescription: フィールド {1} を読んでいない
BugPattern.Details: This field is never read.  Consider removing it from the class.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: 内部 _static_ クラスにすべき。
BugPattern.LongDescription: クラス {0} は内部 _static_ クラスにすべき。
BugPattern.Details: This class is an inner class, but does not use its embedded reference to the object which created it.  This reference makes the instances of the class larger, and may keep the reference to the creator object alive longer than necessary.  If possible, the class should be made into a static inner class.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: waitがループに入っていない
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1}でのwaitがループに入っていない
BugPattern.Details: This method contains a call to java.lang.Object.wait() which is not in a loop.  If the monitor is used for multiple conditions, the condition the caller intended to wait for might not be the one that actually occurred.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: notifyAllではなくnotifyを使っている
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} でnotifyAllではなくnotifyを使っている
BugPattern.Details: This method calls notify() rather than notifyAll().  Java monitors are often used for multiple conditions.  Calling notify() only wakes up one thread, meaning that the thread woken up might not be the one waiting for the condition that the caller just satisfied.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Possible double check of field
BugPattern.LongDescription: Possible doublecheck on {2} in {1}
BugPattern.Details: This is a double check found by the ByteCodePattern-based detector.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Method ignores return value
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} ignores return value of {2}
BugPattern.Details: The return value of this method should be checked.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Null pointer dereference in method
BugPattern.LongDescription: Null pointer dereference in {1}
BugPattern.Details: A null pointer is dereferenced here.  This will lead to a NullPointerException when the code is executed.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Null pointer dereference in method on exception path
BugPattern.LongDescription: Null pointer dereference in {1} on exception path
BugPattern.Details:
A pointer which is null on an exception path is dereferenced here.  This will lead to a NullPointerException when the code is executed.  Note that because FindBugs currently does not prune infeasible exception paths, this may be a false warning.

Also note that FindBugs considers the default case of a switch statement to be an exception path, since the default case is often infeasible.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Possible null pointer dereference in method
BugPattern.LongDescription: Possible null pointer dereference in {1}
BugPattern.Details: A reference value dereferenced here might be null at runtime.  This may lead to a NullPointerException when the code is executed.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Possible null pointer dereference in method on exception path
BugPattern.LongDescription: Possible null pointer dereference in {1} on exception path
BugPattern.Details:
A reference value which is null on some exception control path is dereferenced here.  This may lead to a NullPointerException when the code is executed.  Note that because FindBugs currently does not prune infeasible exception paths, this may be a false warning.

Also note that FindBugs considers the default case of a switch statement to be an exception path, since the default case is often infeasible.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Static initializer for class creates instance before all static final fields assigned
BugPattern.LongDescription: Static initializer for {0} creates instance before all static final fields assigned
BugPattern.Details: The class's static initializer creates an instance of the class before all of the static final fields are assigned.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Method may fail to close stream
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} may fail to close stream
BugPattern.Details: The method creates an IO stream object, does not assign it to any fields, pass it to other methods, or return it, and does not appear to close the stream on all paths out of the method.  This may result in a file descriptor leak.  It is generally a good idea to use a finally block to ensure that streams are closed.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Method may fail to close stream on exception
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} may fail to close stream on exception
BugPattern.Details: The method creates an IO stream object, does not assign it to any fields, pass it to other methods, or return it, and does not appear to close it on all possible exception paths out of the method.  This may result in a file descriptor leak.  It is generally a good idea to use a finally block to ensure that streams are closed.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Consider returning a zero length array rather than null
BugPattern.LongDescription: Should {1} return a zero length array rather than null?
BugPattern.Details: It is generally a better design to return a length zero array rather than a null reference to indicate that there are no results. This way, no explicit check for null is needed by clients of the method.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: serialVersionUID isn't long
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} isn't long
BugPattern.Details: This class defines a serialVersionUID field that is not long.  The field should be made long if it is intended to specify the version UID for purposes of serialization.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Non-transient non-serializable instance field in serializable class
BugPattern.LongDescription: Class {0} defines non-transient non-serializable instance field {1}
BugPattern.Details: This Serializable class defines a non-primitive instance field which is neither transient, Serializable, or java.lang.Object, and does not appear to implement the Externalizable interface or the readObject() and writeObject() methods.  Objects of this class will not be deserialized correctly if a non-Serializable object is stored in this field.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Useless control flow in method
BugPattern.LongDescription: Useless control flow in {1}
BugPattern.Details:
This method contains a useless control flow statement.  Often, this is caused by inadvertently using an empty statement as the body of an if statement, e.g.: 

    if (argv.length == 1);
        System.out.println("Hello, " + argv[0]);

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Redundant comparison to null
BugPattern.LongDescription: Redundant comparison to null in {1}
BugPattern.Details:
This method contains a redundant comparison of a reference value to null. Two types of redundant comparison are reported:

  • Both values compared are definitely null
  • One value is definitely null and the other is definitely not null
In either case, the result of the comparison will always be the same at runtime. This is likely to inidicate a logic error in the method. Often, it means that the reference was dereferenced first, and then tested for null; this can happen because a method was changed without the programmer realizing that the dereferenced value could be null.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Method does not release lock on all paths
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} does not release lock on all paths
BugPattern.Details:
This method acquires a JSR-166 (java.util.concurrent) lock, but does not release it on all paths out of the method. In general, the correct idiom for using a JSR-166 lock is: 

    Lock l = ...;
    l.lock();
    try {
        // do something
    } finally {
        l.unlock();
    }

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Method does not release lock on all exception paths
BugPattern.LongDescription: {1} does not release lock on all exception paths
BugPattern.Details:
This method acquires a JSR-166 (java.util.concurrent) lock, but does not release it on all exception paths out of the method. In general, the correct idiom for using a JSR-166 lock is: 

    Lock l = ...;
    l.lock();
    try {
        // do something
    } finally {
        l.unlock();
    }

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Suspicious reference comparison
BugPattern.LongDescription: Suspicious comparison of {3} references in {1}
BugPattern.Details: This method compares two reference values using the == or != operator, where the correct way to compare instances of this type is generally with the equals() method. Examples of classes which should generally not be compared by reference are java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Float, etc.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Mismatched wait()
BugPattern.LongDescription: Mismatched wait() in {1}
BugPattern.Details: This method calls Object.wait() without obviously holding a lock on the object.  Calling wait() without a lock held will result in an IllegalMonitorStateException being thrown.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Mismatched notify()
BugPattern.LongDescription: Mismatched notify() in {1}
BugPattern.Details: This method calls Object.notify() or Object.notifyAll() without obviously holding a lock on the object.  Calling notify() or notifyAll() without a lock held will result in an IllegalMonitorStateException being thrown.

BugPattern.ShortDescription: Self assignment of local variable
BugPattern.LongDescription: Self assignment of local variable in {1}
BugPattern.Details:
This method contains a self assignment of a local variable; e.g. 

  public void foo() {
    int x = 3;
    x = x;
  }
Such assignments are useless, and may indicate a logic error or typo.
